hypothesis: Levenberg-Marquardt is the classic method for inverse heat problems with fast quadratic convergence. LM is specifically designed for nonlinear least squares - exactly what our RMSE minimization is.

tuning_runs.finding: Time OK but -0.10 score vs baseline
Minimal LM fails - local minima traps, RMSE > 1.0 on some samples

final_result: FAILED - LM fundamentally unsuitable for this problem
abort_reason: LM is a local optimizer that gets stuck in local minima. Finite difference Jacobian requires 3-5 simulations per iteration, making it less sample-efficient than CMA-ES. Cannot match baseline accuracy within time budget.
